ITU-R P.676 -13 1.1 Slant path instantaneous oxygen gaseous attenuation prediction method The predicted slant path instantaneous gaseous attenuation attributable to oxygen, ğ´ğ‘œ, is: ğ´ğ‘œ(ğ‘“,ğ‘ƒğ‘ ,ğ‘‡ğ‘ ,Ïğ‘¤ğ‘ )=Î³ğ‘œ(ğ‘“,ğ‘ğ‘ ,ğ‘‡ğ‘ ,ğ‘’ğ‘ )âˆ™â„ğ‘œ(ğ‘“,ğ‘ƒğ‘ ,ğ‘‡ğ‘ ,Ïğ‘¤ğ‘ ) sinÎ¸ (29) where: ğ‘“ : frequency of interest, in GHz ğ‘ƒğ‘  : instantaneous total (barometric) surface pressure, in hPa, at the desired location ğ‘’ğ‘  : instantaneous surface water vapour partial pressure, in hPa , at the desired location, where ğ‘’ğ‘ =ğœŒğ‘¤ğ‘ ğ‘‡ğ‘  216 .7 ğ‘ğ‘  : instantaneous dry surface pressure, in hPa, at the desired location, ğ‘ğ‘ =ğ‘ƒğ‘ âˆ’ğ‘’ğ‘  ğ‘‡ğ‘  : instantaneous surface temperature, in K, at the desired location Ïğ‘¤ğ‘  : instantaneous surface water vapour density, in g/m3, at the desired location Î¸ : elevation angle Î³ğ‘œ : specific gaseous attenuation attributable to oxygen, in dB/km, given by: Î³ğ‘œ= 0.1820 ğ‘“ ğ‘"ğ‘œğ‘¥ğ‘¦ğ‘”ğ‘’ğ‘› (ğ‘“) (30) ğ‘"ğ‘œğ‘¥ğ‘¦ğ‘”ğ‘’ğ‘› (ğ‘“) is the imaginary part of the oxygen complex radio refractivity given by equation (2a) of Annex 1; and: â„ğ‘œ(ğ‘“,ğ‘ƒğ‘ ,ğ‘‡ğ‘ ,Ïğ‘¤ğ‘ )=ğ‘ğ‘œ(ğ‘“)+ğ‘ğ‘œ(ğ‘“)âˆ™ğ‘‡ğ‘ +ğ‘ğ‘œ(ğ‘“)âˆ™ğ‘ƒğ‘ +ğ‘‘ğ‘œ(ğ‘“)âˆ™Ïğ‘¤ğ‘  (31) The coefficients ğ‘ğ‘œ, ğ‘ğ‘œ, ğ‘ğ‘œ and ğ‘‘ğ‘œ at the frequency of interest should be linearly interpolated between the frequencies in the data file Part 1 , which is an integral part of this Recommendation3. The data file contains the coefficients ğ‘ğ‘œ, ğ‘ğ‘œ, ğ‘ğ‘œ and ğ‘‘ğ‘œ for frequencies between 1 GHz and 350 GHz in 0.5 GHz increments and an additional frequency of 118.75 GHz. 1.2 Slant path statistical oxygen gaseous attenuation prediction method The predicted slant path statistical gaseous attenuation attributable to oxygen, ğ´ğ‘œ, is: ğ´ğ‘œ(ğ‘“,ğ‘)=Î³ğ‘œ(ğ‘“,ğ‘ğ‘ Ì…Ì…Ì…,ğ‘‡ğ‘ Ì…,ğ‘’ğ‘ Ì…)âˆ™â„ğ‘œ(ğ‘“,ğ‘ƒğ‘ (ğ‘),ğ‘‡ğ‘ (ğ‘),Ïğ‘¤ğ‘ (ğ‘)) sinÎ¸ (32) where: ğ‘“ : frequency of interest, in GHz ğ‘ƒğ‘ Ì… : mean total (barometric) surface pressure, in hPa, at the desired location
